description: Corosync through 3.1.9, if encryption is disabled or the attacker knows the encryption key, has a stack-based buffer overflow in orf_token_endian_convert in exec/totemsrp.c via a large UDP packet.
summary: This vulnerability in Corosync, a program used for cluster communication, could allow an attacker to send a large UDP packet and potentially execute malicious code, leading to a denial of service or even remote code execution. This affects users of Corosync version 3.1.9 and below if encryption is disabled or if the attacker knows the encryption key. To mitigate this threat, users should update to the latest version of Corosync and ensure that encryption is enabled to protect against potential attacks.

description: The Motors – Car Dealer, Classifieds & Listing plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability checks on the motors_create_template and motors_delete_template functions in all versions up to, and including, 1.4.57. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to delete arbitrary posts or create listing templates. This issue requires Elementor plugin to be installed, which is a required plugin for Motors Starter Theme.
summary: The Motors – Car Dealer, Classifieds & Listing plugin for WordPress has a vulnerability that allows attackers with certain levels of access to delete posts or create templates. This affects WordPress sites using the plugin up to version 1.4.57 and requires the Elementor plugin to be installed. Users should update to the latest version of the Motors plugin to prevent unauthorized data modification.
software: Motors – Car Dealer, Classifieds & Listing plugin

description: The Newsletters plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the "to" parameter in all versions up to, and including, 4.9.9.7 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick an admin user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: This vulnerability in the Newsletters plugin for WordPress allows attackers to inject malicious scripts into web pages if an admin user is tricked into clicking on a link. This affects all versions up to 4.9.9.7. To protect against this threat, users should update to the latest version of the plugin and be cautious when clicking on links from unknown sources.

description: The ProfileGrid – User Profiles, Groups and Communities plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to blind and time-based SQL Injections via the rid and search parameters in all versions up to, and including, 5.9.4.7 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query.  This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.
summary: The ProfileGrid plugin for WordPress is at risk of a SQL Injection vulnerability, which allows attackers with certain access levels to extract sensitive information from the database. Users of this plugin should update to version 5.9.4.8 or later to mitigate this threat.

description: The ProfileGrid – User Profiles, Groups and Communities plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection in all versions up to, and including, 5.9.4.5 via deserialization of untrusted input in the get_user_meta_fields_html function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to inject a PHP Object. No known POP chain is present in the vulnerable software, which means this vulnerability has no impact unless another plugin or theme containing a POP chain is installed on the site. If a POP chain is present via an additional plugin or theme installed on the target system, it may allow the attacker to perform actions like delete arbitrary files, retrieve sensitive data, or execute code depending on the POP chain present.
summary: The ProfileGrid WordPress plugin is vulnerable to a PHP Object Injection flaw that allows attackers with Subscriber-level access or above to inject malicious code. This vulnerability can be exploited if the site has another plugin or theme with a specific type of vulnerability. Users should update the plugin to version 5.9.4.6 or later to mitigate the risk of exploitation.
software: ProfileGrid – User Profiles, Groups and Communities plugin for WordPress

description: The ProfileGrid – User Profiles, Groups and Communities plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the pm_decline_join_group_request and pm_approve_join_group_request functions in all versions up to, and including, 5.9.4.4. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to approve or decline join group requests which is normally should be available to administrators only.
summary: The ProfileGrid plugin for WordPress allows unauthorized users with certain access levels to approve or decline group join requests, which should only be done by administrators. This vulnerability affects all versions of the plugin up to 5.9.4.4. Users should update to the latest version of the plugin to patch this vulnerability and prevent unauthorized data modification.
software: ProfileGrid – User Profiles, Groups and Communities plugin for WordPress

description: The CITS Support svg, webp Media and TTF,OTF File Upload, Use Custom Fonts plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 4.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the cits_assign_fonts_tab() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to delete font assignments via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: This vulnerability in the CITS Support plugin for WordPress allows attackers to delete font assignments on a website if they can trick a site administrator into clicking a link. This could affect any website using this plugin up to version 4.2. Site owners should update the plugin to the latest version to prevent this type of attack.
software: Use Custom Fonts plugin for WordPress

description: The Your Friendly Drag and Drop Page Builder — Make Builder plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.10 via the make_builder_ajax_subscribe() function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to make web requests to arbitrary locations originating from the web application and can be used to query and modify information from internal services.
summary: The Your Friendly Drag and Drop Page Builder plugin for WordPress is at risk of a Server-Side Request Forgery vulnerability, which could allow attackers with Subscriber-level access or above to make unauthorized web requests. This could potentially lead to access and modification of internal services. Users of this plugin should update to version 1.1.11 or higher to prevent exploitation of this vulnerability.
software: Your Friendly Drag and Drop Page Builder — Make Builder plugin for WordPress

description: The CITS Support svg, webp Media and TTF,OTF File Upload, Use Custom Fonts plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 4.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the cits_settings_tab() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to update the plugin's settings via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: The CITS Support plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to a Cross-Site Request Forgery attack in versions up to 4.2. This vulnerability could allow attackers to manipulate the plugin's settings if they can trick a site administrator into clicking on a malicious link. It is recommended to update the plugin to the latest version to mitigate this threat.
software: CITS Support svg, webp Media and TTF,OTF File Upload, Use Custom Fonts plugin for WordPress

description: The WooCommerce Multivendor Marketplace – REST API plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the 'id' parameter in the update_delivery_status() function in all versions up to, and including, 1.6.2 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query.  This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.
summary: The WooCommerce Multivendor Marketplace – REST API plugin for WordPress is at risk of SQL Injection due to a vulnerability in the 'id' parameter. This vulnerability affects all versions up to and including 1.6.2. Authenticated attackers with Subscriber-level access or higher are able to exploit this vulnerability to extract sensitive information from the database. Users should update the plugin to version 1.6.3 or later to mitigate this threat.
software: WooCommerce Multivendor Marketplace – REST API plugin

description: The Block Logic – Full Gutenberg Block Display Control plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Remote Code Execution in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.8 via the block_logic_check_logic function. This is due to the unsafe evaluation of user-controlled input. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to execute code on the server.
summary: This vulnerability in the Block Logic plugin for WordPress allows attackers with Contributor-level access or higher to remotely execute code on the server. Users of this plugin should update to version 1.0.9 or higher as soon as possible to protect their websites from potential exploitation.
software: Block Logic – Full Gutenberg Block Display Control plugin

description: The CryoKey plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘ckemail’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 2.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: The CryoKey plugin for WordPress is at risk of a cyber attack called Reflected Cross-Site Scripting, which allows attackers to inject harmful scripts into web pages. This affects anyone using the CryoKey plugin up to version 2.4. To protect against this threat, users should update the plugin to the latest version as soon as possible.

description: The Code Clone plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to time-based SQL Injection via the ‘snippetId’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 0.9 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.
summary: The Code Clone plugin for WordPress has a security flaw that can be exploited by attackers with Administrator-level access or higher to extract sensitive information from the database using time-based SQL Injection. All versions up to 0.9 are affected. Users should update to the latest version of the plugin to protect against this threat.

description: The Easy Custom Admin Bar plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘msg’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: The Easy Custom Admin Bar plugin for WordPress has a security vulnerability that could allow attackers to inject harmful scripts into web pages. This could affect anyone using the plugin up to version 1.0. Users should update to a newer version or disable the plugin to protect themselves from potential attacks.

description: The Gotcha | Gesture-based Captcha plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the 'menu' parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: The Gotcha plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to a type of cyber attack called Reflected Cross-Site Scripting. This means that attackers can inject harmful web scripts into pages if they can trick a user into clicking on a link. This affects all versions of the plugin up to 1.0.0. Website administrators using this plugin should update to the latest version or consider implementing a different security solution to prevent this type of attack.
software: Gotcha | Gesture-based Captcha plugin for WordPress

description: The Multi Video Box plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the 'video_id' and 'group_id' parameters in all versions up to, and including, 1.5.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: The Multi Video Box plugin for WordPress is at risk of a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting attack, which could allow hackers to inject harmful scripts into web pages if users are tricked into clicking on a malicious link. This vulnerability affects all versions up to 1.5.2. It is recommended to update the plugin to the latest version to patch this issue and prevent potential attacks.
software: Multi Video Box plugin for WordPress

description: The Fluent Forms – Customizable Contact Forms, Survey, Quiz, & Conversational Form Builder plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to IP Address Spoofing in all versions up to, and including, 5.2.12 due to insufficient IP address validation and use of user-supplied HTTP headers as a primary method for IP retrieval. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers spoof their IP address and submit forms that may have IP-based restrictions.
summary: The Fluent Forms plugin for WordPress is at risk of allowing attackers to falsify their IP address when submitting forms. This vulnerability affects all versions up to 5.2.12. Website administrators should update to the latest version of the plugin to protect against this threat.

description: A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in yangyouwang 杨有旺 crud 简约后台管理系统 1.0.0. Affected is an unknown function of the component Role Management Page. The manipulation leads to cross site scripting. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability in yangyouwang CRUD management system allows attackers to carry out a cross-site scripting attack remotely. This could affect anyone using the system. To mitigate the risk, users should update to the latest version of the software and be cautious of any suspicious links or messages that could exploit this vulnerability.
software: yangyouwang 杨有旺 crud 简约后台管理系统 1.0.0

description: The Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2.6.2 via the validate_file() function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to make web requests to arbitrary locations originating from the web application and can be used to query and modify information from internal services.
summary: This vulnerability in the Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress allows attackers with Administrator-level access to make unauthorized web requests to different locations. This can be used to access and manipulate internal service information. To mitigate this threat, users should update the plugin to version 2.6.3 or remove it entirely from their WordPress installations.
software: Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress

description: The Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection in all versions up to, and including, 2.6.2 via deserialization of untrusted input from the 'form_data' parameter. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to inject a PHP Object. No known POP chain is present in the vulnerable software, which means this vulnerability has no impact unless another plugin or theme containing a POP chain is installed on the site. If a POP chain is present via an additional plugin or theme installed on the target system, it may allow the attacker to perform actions like delete arbitrary files, retrieve sensitive data, or execute code depending on the POP chain present.
summary: The Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress has a vulnerability that could allow authenticated attackers with Administrator-level access to inject malicious PHP Objects. This could lead to actions like deleting files, accessing sensitive data, or executing code on the website. Users should update the plugin to version 2.6.3 or higher to fix this issue and ensure their website's security.
software: Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress

description: The Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file deletion due to insufficient file path validation in the admin_log_page() function in all versions up to, and including, 2.6.2. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to delete arbitrary log files on the server.
summary: A plugin for WordPress called Export and Import Users and Customers has a security vulnerability that allows attackers with administrator-level access to delete log files on the server. This affects users of the plugin up to version 2.6.2. Users are advised to update to the latest version of the plugin to fix this issue and prevent unauthorized file deletions.
software: Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress

description: The Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Path Traversal in all versions up to, and including, 2.6.2 via the download_file() function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to read the contents of arbitrary log files on the server, which can contain sensitive information.
summary: The Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress has a vulnerability that allows attackers with Administrator-level access to read sensitive information from server log files. Users of this plugin should update to version 2.6.3 or disable it to protect their information.
software: Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress

description: The GiveWP – Donation Plugin and Fundraising Platform plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 3.22.1 via a misconfigured capability check in the 'permissionsCheck' function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to extract sensitive data including reports detailing donors and donation amounts.
summary: The GiveWP plugin for WordPress is at risk of exposing sensitive information to attackers. This vulnerability affects all versions up to 3.22.1. Authenticated attackers with Subscriber-level access or above can access reports containing donor and donation information. Users should update to the latest version of the plugin to fix this issue.

description: The Bitspecter Suite plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via SVG File uploads in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Author-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses the SVG file.
summary: This vulnerability in the Bitspecter Suite plugin for WordPress allows attackers with Author-level access or higher to inject harmful scripts into web pages using SVG file uploads. To protect against this, users should update the plugin to a version higher than 1.0.0 to fix the issue.

description:
** UNSUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Apache Oozie.

This issue affects Apache Oozie: all versions.

As this project is retired, we do not plan to release a version that fixes this issue. Users are recommended to find an alternative or restrict access to the instance to trusted users.

NOTE: This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.
summary: The Apache Oozie project has an issue that could allow attackers to execute malicious scripts on web pages, known as cross-site scripting. This vulnerability affects all versions of Apache Oozie. Since the project is retired, there will not be a fix released. Users are advised to either find an alternative solution or limit access to the instance to trusted users.

description: The Recover WooCommerce Cart Abandonment, Newsletter, Email Marketing, Marketing Automation By FunnelKit plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the ‘automationId’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 3.5.1 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query.  This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.
summary: This plugin for WordPress is at risk of being hacked by unauthenticated attackers through a SQL Injection vulnerability. This could potentially lead to the theft of sensitive information from the database. Users of this plugin should update to version 3.5.2 or newer to fix this issue and protect their data.

description: A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in yangyouwang 杨有旺 crud 简约后台管理系统 1.0.0. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the component Department Page. The manipulation leads to cross site scripting. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability in the yangyouwang CRUD简约后台管理系统 1.0.0 allows for cross-site scripting on the Department Page, putting those who use this system at risk of a remote attack. Users of this system should update to a secure version to protect against potential exploits.
software: crud 简约后台管理系统

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in D-Link DAP-1620 1.03. Affected by this issue is the function set_ws_action of the file /dws/api/ of the component Path Handler. The manipulation leads to heap-based buffer overflow. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.
summary: There is a critical vulnerability in D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 that allows for remote attackers to cause a heap-based buffer overflow, potentially leading to a compromise of the system. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by D-Link. It is recommended to update to a supported device or implement additional security measures to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, was found in D-Link DAP-1620 1.03. This affects the function check_dws_cookie of the file /storage of the component Cookie Handler. The manipulation leads to stack-based buffer overflow. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.
summary: The D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 has a critical vulnerability that allows for remote attackers to initiate a stack-based buffer overflow. This may lead to unauthorized access to the system. The exploit has been made public and can be used by attackers. However, this vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer. Users of the affected device should take precautionary measures such as discontinuing its use or updating to a newer model that is supported by the manufacturer.

description: A vulnerability has been found in D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 and classified as critical. This vulnerability affects the function mod_graph_auth_uri_handler of the file /storage of the component Authentication Handler. The manipulation leads to stack-based buffer overflow. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.
summary: The D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 router has a critical vulnerability that allows a remote attacker to trigger a stack-based buffer overflow. This could lead to unauthorized access or denial of service. This only affects devices that are no longer supported by the manufacturer. Users of the affected devices should replace them with newer, supported models to protect against potential attacks.

description: A vulnerability was found in D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 and classified as critical. This issue affects the function check_dws_cookie of the file /storage. The manipulation of the argument uid leads to stack-based buffer overflow. The attack may be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.
summary: The D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 has a critical vulnerability that allows for remote attackers to cause a stack-based buffer overflow by manipulating a specific argument. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported, but users should be aware of the risk and take caution with their devices. It is recommended to update to a supported version of the product if possible to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

description: A vulnerability was found in aizuda snail-job 1.4.0. It has been classified as critical. Affected is the function getRuntime of the file /snail-job/workflow/check-node-expression of the component Workflow-Task Management Module. The manipulation of the argument nodeExpression leads to deserialization. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: The CVE is a critical vulnerability found in the aizuda snail-job software version 1.4.0, specifically in the Workflow-Task Management Module. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to manipulate arguments and launch attacks through deserialization. Users of this software should update to a patched version as soon as possible to prevent exploitation.

description: A vulnerability was found in westboy CicadasCMS 1.0. It has been declared as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /system/cms/content/save. The manipulation of the argument title/content/laiyuan leads to cross site scripting. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability in westboy CicadasCMS 1.0 allows for cross site scripting attacks when manipulating certain arguments in the system. This vulnerability affects users of the CMS and could be exploited remotely by attackers. Users should update to a patched version of the software to protect against this threat.

description: A vulnerability was found in westboy CicadasCMS 1.0. It has been rated as critical. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality of the file /system/cms/content/save. The manipulation of the argument content/fujian/laiyuan leads to sql injection. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

The exploit has been disclosed publicly and can affect users of this content management system. summary: A critical vulnerability has been discovered in westboy CicadasCMS 1.0 which allows for SQL injection by manipulating specific arguments. This could be exploited remotely, putting users of the CMS at risk. It is advisable to update to a patched version of the software as soon as possible to mitigate the threat.

description: A vulnerability classified as critical was found in SourceCodester Kortex Lite Advocate Office Management System 1.0. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file edit_case.php. The manipulation of the argument ID leads to sql injection. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

The manipulation of the argument ishot with the input 1 leads to improper authorization. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

This can be done remotely by manipulating certain arguments in the component Article Handler. Users of JIZHICMS up to version 1.7.0 should take immediate action to update their software to the latest version and ensure all security measures are in place to prevent any unauthorized access.

description: A vulnerability has been found in JIZHICMS up to 1.7.0 and classified as problematic. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file /user/release.html of the component Article Handler. The manipulation leads to improper authorization. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability in JIZHICMS up to version 1.7.0 can be exploited by attackers to bypass authorization controls and gain unauthorized access to the system. description: A vulnerability was found in PHPGurukul Doctor Appointment Management System 1.0 and classified as critical. This issue affects some unknown processing of the file /doctor/appointment-bwdates-reports-details.php. The manipulation of the argument fromdate/todate leads to sql injection. summary: This vulnerability in PHPGurukul Doctor Appointment Management System allows hackers to inject malicious code through a certain file, which can then be used to remotely access sensitive information in the system. Users of this system should update to the latest version to protect against potential attacks.

Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality of the file /admin/edit-artist-detail.php?editid=1. The manipulation of the argument Name leads to sql injection. description: The Nested Pages WordPress plugin before 3.2.13 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as contributors to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).
summary: The Nested Pages WordPress plugin has a security flaw that could allow high privilege users to carry out Cross-Site Scripting attacks, even if certain permissions are restricted. This vulnerability could impact users of the plugin, particularly in a multisite setup. Users should update to version 3.2.13 or newer to protect against this threat.

description: The Pods  WordPress plugin before 3.2.8.2 does not sanitize and escape a parameter before using it in a SQL statement, allowing admins to perform SQL injection attacks
summary: A vulnerability has been found in the Pods WordPress plugin version before 3.2.8.2, which could allow attackers to perform SQL injection attacks. This affects users of the Pods plugin. Users should update their plugin to version 3.2.8.2 or later to protect against this vulnerability.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, was found in PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0. This affects an unknown part of the file /admin/edit-art-product-detail.php?editid=2. The manipulation of the argument editide/sprice/description leads to sql injection. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This CVE is a critical vulnerability found in the PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0, specifically in the file /admin/edit-art-product-detail.php?editid=2. This vulnerability allows for SQL injection by manipulating the argument editid/sprice/description and can be initiated remotely. To protect against potential attacks, users of this system should update to a secure version as soon as possible.

description: Attila Szász discovered that the HFS+ file system implementation in the Linux Kernel contained a heap overflow vulnerability. An attacker could use a specially crafted file system image that, when mounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.
summary: This vulnerability in the Linux Kernel's HFS+ file system could be exploited by an attacker by using a carefully constructed file system image to crash the system or run harmful code. This could impact users of Linux systems with the HFS+ file system. To mitigate this threat, users are advised to update their kernels to a version that includes the fix for this vulnerability.

description:
Relative Path Traversal vulnerability in Apache Commons VFS before 2.10.0.

The FileObject API in Commons VFS has a 'resolveFile' method that
takes a 'scope' parameter. Specifying 'NameScope.DESCENDENT' promises that "an exception is thrown if the resolved file is not a descendent of
the base file". However, when the path contains encoded ".."
characters (for example, "%2E%2E/bar.txt"), it might return file objects that are not
a descendent of the base file, without throwing an exception.
This issue affects Apache Commons VFS: before 2.10.0.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.10.0, which fixes the issue.
summary: A vulnerability in Apache Commons VFS before version 2.10.0 allows attackers to access files outside of the intended directory by using specially crafted paths. This vulnerability affects users of Apache Commons VFS before version 2.10.0. To protect against this threat, users should upgrade to version 2.10.0 which addresses this issue.

The manipulation leads to exposure of information through directory listing. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. It is recommended to change the configuration settings. Multiple sub-directories are affected.

description: Versions of the package nossrf before 1.0.4 are vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) where an attacker can provide a hostname that resolves to a local or reserved IP address space and bypass the SSRF protection mechanism.
summary: A vulnerability in the package nossrf allows attackers to bypass protection measures and potentially initiate Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) attacks. This vulnerability affects users of versions of nossrf before 1.0.4. To mitigate this threat, users should update to version 1.0.4 or newer.

description:
Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability in Apache Commons VFS.

The FtpFileObject class can throw an exception when a file is not found, revealing the original URI in its message, which may include a password. The fix is to mask the password in the exception message
This issue affects Apache Commons VFS: before 2.10.0.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.10.0, which fixes the issue.
summary: The CVE refers to a vulnerability in Apache Commons VFS that can expose sensitive information, such as passwords, to unauthorized actors through exceptions thrown by the FtpFileObject class. This vulnerability affects Apache Commons VFS versions before 2.10.0. To protect against this threat, users are advised to upgrade to version 2.10.0, which includes a fix that masks passwords in exception messages.

description: A vulnerability was found in FoxCMS 1.25 and classified as problematic. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality. The manipulation leads to improper authorization. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

description: Improper link resolution before file access ('link following') in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) allows an authorized attacker to elevate privileges locally.
summary: This vulnerability in Microsoft Edge allows an attacker to gain higher privileges on a computer by tricking the user into clicking on a malicious link. This affects users of Microsoft Edge who use the Chromium-based version of the browser. To protect against this threat, users should ensure they are using the latest version of Microsoft Edge and be cautious when clicking on unknown links.

description: No cwe for this issue in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) allows an unauthorized attacker to execute code over a network.
summary: This CVE in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based browser) allows attackers to run code over a network without authorization. This issue affects users of Microsoft Edge. Users should update their browser to the latest version to mitigate this threat.
